latin_text: Rex demens imperavit nos procdere. Iuberet mare immotum esse ut unam fluctum servaret.
english_text: The demented king has ordered us to proceed. He would command the sea to be still to save one wave.

latin_text: Non scimus quid cornices attrahat. Cotidie plus sternuntur per vias ostiaque.
english_text: We do not know what attracts the crows. Every day more scatter about the roads and thresholds.

latin_text: Aenigma est quomodo spiritum retinere ut maneat etiam cum corpus ruptum sit.
english_text: The puzzle is how to restrain the spirit so it stays even when the body has been broken.

latin_text: Ex apud cornicebus nonnullae loqui coeperunt, sed raro intellegimus. Putabamus eam linguam Aegyptiam esse, sed Balbus, qui bene linguam Aegyptiam scit, non agnovit.
english_text: Some from among the crows have begun to speak, but rarely do we understand. We thoguht their language was Egyptian, but Balbus, who knows Egyptian well, did not recognize it.

latin_text: Semper repimus cupidum regis. Primo mathematici, alchymistae, magi, theologique putabant trahere eam filis separatis, sed nunc clare videmus omnes extrahere a textili idem.
english_text: Always we crawl closer to the king's wish. At first the astrologers, the alchemists, and the theologians thought they pulled on separate threads, but now we clearly see everyone draws from the same cloth.

latin_text: Solum non tam fertile est quam olim, at homines e villae superioribus esuriunt et solliciti fiunt.
english_text: The soil is not as fertile as it once was, and the people from the villages above hunger and grow agitated.

latin_text: Rex senex nunc est, at dum vita eius procedit aetas eius cautionem magis debilit.
english_text: The king is an old man now, and as his life goes on his age further cripples his caution.
